step1.sentence: She managed to keep her side project under the radar until it was ready to launch.

step2.story: The new intern had been quietly fixing bugs under the radar for weeks. No one in management had noticed until the lead developer praised the improvements in a team meeting. From that day on, everyone wanted to know who the mystery problem-solver was.

step3.story: Marcus had been building his small online store under the radar for nearly a year, telling only his closest friends about it. He didn't want the pressure of expectations while he was still figuring things out. One morning, a post about his handmade goods went viral, and suddenly thousands of people flooded his site. He sat at his desk, stunned, realizing his quiet little project was no longer a secret. What had once felt safely hidden was now in the spotlight, and there was no going back.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 레이더 아래에 있다는 뜻으로, 탐지 장치에 잡히지 않는 상태를 가리킨다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 다른 사람들의 주목이나 관심을 받지 않고 조용히 무언가를 하거나 존재할 때 사용한다. 의도적으로 눈에 띄지 않으려는 상황에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 군사 및 항공 용어에서 유래했으며, 레이더 탐지망에 걸리지 않도록 낮게 비행하는 전술에서 비롯된 표현이다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 중립적이거나 긍정적인 뉘앙스로 쓰이는 경우가 많지만, 문맥에 따라 의도적으로 숨기거나 규칙을 피한다는 부정적인 뉘앙스도 담길 수 있다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The startup stayed under the radar until they were ready to announce their product.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 스타트업은 제품 발표 준비가 될 때까지 눈에 띄지 않게 활동했다.
